recipe.title: Beef Wellington
recipe.description: Luxurious beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry with mushroom duxelles

steps.descr: Sear beef on all sides, brush with mustard, let cool
steps.instructions: Sear beef on all sides, brush with mustard, let cool

on_enter.say: Let's get started by searing the beef on all sides until it's beautifully browned. Then, we'll brush it with a bit of Dijon mustard and let it cool. You'll love the aroma!

steps.descr: Cook mushrooms until all liquid evaporates, season well
steps.instructions: Cook mushrooms until all liquid evaporates, season well

on_enter.say: Now, let's cook those mushrooms until all the liquid evaporates. Season them well, and you'll notice a lovely earthy smell filling your kitchen.

steps.descr: Lay ham on plastic wrap, spread with pâté and mushrooms
steps.instructions: Lay ham on plastic wrap, spread with pâté and mushrooms

on_enter.say: Let's lay out the Parma ham on some plastic wrap. Spread it with the pâté and then the mushrooms. This is going to add so much flavour!

steps.descr: Wrap beef in ham layer, refrigerate 30 minutes
steps.instructions: Wrap beef in ham layer, refrigerate 30 minutes

on_enter.say: Now, let's wrap the beef in that lovely ham layer. Once it's snug, pop it in the fridge for thirty minutes. This helps it hold its shape.

steps.descr: Wrap in puff pastry, seal edges, brush with egg
steps.instructions: Wrap in puff pastry, seal edges, brush with egg

on_enter.say: Let's wrap our beef in the puff pastry now. Make sure to seal the edges well and give it a nice brush with egg yolk. It's going to look stunning!

steps.descr: Bake at 200°C for 35-40 minutes until golden
steps.instructions: Bake at 200°C for 35-40 minutes until golden

on_enter.say: Time to bake our Wellington! Set the oven to two hundred degrees celsius, that's about three ninety-five fahrenheit, and let it bake for thirty-five to forty minutes until it's beautifully golden.
Brilliant! Let the Wellington rest for ten minutes before slicing. This is really important to let all those lovely juices settle. Then, it's time to enjoy!

notes.text:
Use a meat thermometer for perfect doneness
Make sure mushrooms are completely dry
This is a showstopper - perfect for special occasions
